profile.name: Jarred Sumner
profile.bio: Software engineer building the future of web. 💻 Passionate about open source, sharing insights, and learning in public. Sometimes hot takes on dev ops & DX. SF based. ☕

tweets.content: Thread: Saw the new release notes for [hypothetical popular library]. The performance improvements look incredible, especially for [specific feature]. Might be time for an upgrade. #techupdate
My git commit messages swing wildly between 'feat: implement user auth' and 'fixed it, mostly'. No in-between.
The amount of boilerplate code people accept in some languages just blows my mind. There *has* to be a better way than writing the same 5 lines 100 times. #softwaredevelopment

Saw that article about [hypothetical major tech company] deprecating [tool]. Not surprised, but still feels like a lot of migration overhead for many. Hope they provide a smooth transition path. #tech #devops
Opened a small PR to fix a minor bug in a project I've been following. Always rewarding to contribute even a tiny bit to something you appreciate. #FOSS #bugfix
Is it just me, or does the 'learn in public' trend often devolve into 'performative learning' rather than genuine sharing? There's a fine line. #developer #community
Excited to be diving deep into a new distributed systems project at work this quarter. Lots to learn, but the challenge is invigorating. Wish me luck! 🚀
Hot take: Microservices are often over-engineered solutions to organizational problems, not technical ones. Convince me otherwise. #architecture #backend
WIP: Building a small CLI tool to help manage my dotfiles across machines. It's surprisingly fun to dive into Rust for this. Screenshot soon! ⚙️ #rustlang #buildinpublic
Just merged my first small PR to an open-source library I use daily. It was just a docs fix, but it's a start! Feeling good about contributing back. #opensource #contribute
Unpopular opinion: If your `package.json` has more lines than your actual app code, maybe rethink your dependencies. Just saying. #webdev #javascript

Me: *spends 3 hours debugging a typo*
My code: *works perfectly after changing one character*
Me: 'I am a genius.'
Been playing around with WebAssembly for a proof-of-concept. It's surprisingly powerful for certain computations. Anyone else experimenting with WASM beyond the hype? What are your use cases?

Just spent an hour refactoring a particularly gnarly piece of legacy code. It now makes sense! The feeling of untangling complexity is truly unmatched. My future self will thank me. #softwareengineering
The speed at which new JS frameworks appear vs. how quickly they actually solve *new* problems is... interesting. Sometimes the old reliable is just fine. #javascript #frameworks
Considering spinning up a new open-source project around [hypothetical niche area]. Does anyone have experience with [specific tech] for project bootstrapping? Looking for advice on initial tooling.
Finally got the custom hook for lazy-loading images working perfectly in this side project. Huge win for performance! ✨ Small steps but it feels good. #react #frontend
Debugging in production at 2 AM is my cardio.
